subprocess_flow.description: Identify and select plant and animal species suitable for introduction based on their ecological roles, adaptability to the environment, and potential impact on existing ecosystems. This involves reviewing species databases, consulting with ecological experts, and assessing the availability of species for introduction. The selection process prioritizes species that can enhance ecosystem stability and resilience.
success_criteria: Species selected are adaptable to the environment
subprocess_flow.purpose: To choose species that will thrive and contribute positively to the ecosystem.
subprocess_flow.scope: Selection of species for introduction based on ecological suitability and adaptability.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Thorough risk assessment of selected species
Selection of adaptable species with diverse traits

change_management.change_request_process: Submit request to God for species changes
change_management.versioning_rules: Track species changes and ecosystem impacts

subprocess_flow.description: Prepare habitats for the introduction of selected species by ensuring suitable conditions for their survival and reproduction. This includes modifying existing habitats, creating new habitats, and managing resources to support the introduced species. The preparation process considers the specific needs of each species and aims to minimize disruption to existing ecosystems.
success_criteria: Habitats are suitable for selected species
Disruption to existing ecosystems is minimized
subprocess_flow.purpose: To ensure that the introduced species have a suitable environment to thrive in.
subprocess_flow.scope: Preparation of habitats for the introduction of selected species.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Implementation of sustainable resource management practices

change_management.change_request_process: Submit request to God for habitat changes

subprocess_flow.description: Introduce selected plant and animal species into prepared habitats, ensuring their safe and successful integration into existing ecosystems. This involves carefully transporting species, releasing them into suitable locations, and monitoring their initial adaptation. The introduction process considers the specific needs of each species and aims to minimize stress and maximize survival rates.
success_criteria: Species are safely introduced into habitats
Species show initial signs of adaptation
subprocess_flow.purpose: To safely introduce the selected species into their new environment.
subprocess_flow.scope: Introduction of selected species into prepared habitats.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Careful handling and transportation of species
Gradual introduction and monitoring of species interactions

change_management.change_request_process: Submit request to God for introduction changes

subprocess_flow.description: Monitor the impact of introduced species on existing ecosystems, assessing their interactions with native species, their contribution to ecosystem stability, and their overall effect on biodiversity. This involves collecting data on species populations, resource levels, and ecosystem health indicators. The monitoring process aims to identify and address any negative impacts and ensure the long-term sustainability of the expanded biodiversity.
success_criteria: Ecosystem stability is maintained or enhanced
subprocess_flow.purpose: To ensure that the introduced species are positively contributing to the ecosystem.
subprocess_flow.scope: Monitoring the impact of introduced species on existing ecosystems.
end_conditions: Data is regularly collected and analyzed

step_risks_and_controls.control: Careful monitoring of species populations and resource levels

change_management.change_request_process: Submit request to God for ecosystem adjustments
